alert.note: Alert for Lee (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 4:02AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Claiborne, Grainger, Hancock and Union. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sneedville, Rutledge, Jonesville, Plainview, Harrogate, Luttrell, Howard Quarter, Evanston, Ewing, Thorn Hill, Rose Hill, Cumberland Gap and Joppa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
